member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnArrested
member.summary:
The action to take if your step is waiting for the instance group to start and it enters the Arrested state.
Fail - Fail the step. Wait - Continue waiting until the instance group is no longer arrested (requires manual intervention). Continue - Proceed onto the next step.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnFailure
member.summary: Action to take if there is a failure modifying your cluster composition. Fail - Fail the step. Continue - Proceed on to the next step.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.AddJobFlowStepsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AddJobFlowSteps operation. AddJobFlowSteps adds new steps to a running cluster. A maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each job flow.
If your cluster is long-running (such as a Hive data warehouse) or complex, you may require more than 256 steps to process your data. You can bypass the 256-step limitation in various ways, including using SSH to connect to the master node and submitting queries directly to the software running on the master node, such as Hive and Hadoop. For more information on how to do this, see Add More than 256 Steps to a Cluster in the Amazon EMR Management Guide.
A step specifies the location of a JAR file stored either on the master node of the cluster or in Amazon S3. Each step is performed by the main function of the main class of the JAR file. The main class can be specified either in the manifest of the JAR or by using the MainFunction parameter of the step.
Amazon EMR executes each step in the order listed. For a step to be considered complete, the main function must exit with a zero exit code and all Hadoop jobs started while the step was running must have completed and run successfully.
You can only add steps to a cluster that is in one of the following states: STARTING, BOOTSTRAPPING, RUNNING, or WAITING.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Application
member.summary:
With Amazon EMR release version 4.0 and later, the only accepted parameter is the application name. To pass arguments to applications, you use configuration classifications specified using configuration JSON objects. For more information, see Configuring Applications.
With earlier Amazon EMR releases, the application is any Amazon or third-party software that you can add to the cluster. This structure contains a list of strings that indicates the software to use with the cluster and accepts a user argument list. Amazon EMR accepts and forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as bootstrap action argument.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.AutoTerminationPolicy
member.summary: An auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. An auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in seconds after which a cluster automatically terminates. For alternative cluster termination options, see Control cluster termination.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.AutoTerminationPolicy.IdleTimeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdleTimeout.
Specifies the amount of idle time in seconds after which the cluster automatically terminates. You can specify a minimum of 60 seconds and a maximum of 604800 seconds (seven days).

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
member.summary: A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. When BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules is set to true, Amazon EMR prevents cluster creation if one of the cluster's security groups has a rule that allows inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an exception using PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules.
Indicates whether Amazon EMR block public access is enabled (true) or disabled (false). By default, the value is false for accounts that have created EMR clusters before July 2019. For accounts created after this, the default is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges.
Specifies ports and port ranges that are permitted to have security group rules that allow inbound traffic from all public sources. For example, if Port 23 (Telnet) is specified for PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges, Amazon EMR allows cluster creation if a security group associated with the cluster has a rule that allows inbound traffic on Port 23 from IPv4 0.0.0.0/0 or IPv6 port ::/0 as the source.
By default, Port 22, which is used for SSH access to the cluster EC2 instances, is in the list of PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata
member.summary: Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that created the BlockPublicAccessConfiguration using the PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration action as well as the date and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration for block public access is updated, Amazon EMR updates this metadata.

The Amazon Resource Name that created or last modified the configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CancelSteps operation. Cancels a pending step or steps in a running cluster. Available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding version 5.0.0. A maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each CancelSteps request. CancelSteps is idempotent but asynchronous; it does not guarantee that a step will be canceled, even if the request is successfully submitted. When you use Amazon EMR versions 5.28.0 and later, you can cancel steps that are in a PENDING or RUNNING state. In earlier versions of Amazon EMR, you can only cancel steps that are in a PENDING state.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsRequest.ClusterId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterId.
The ClusterID for the specified steps that will be canceled. Use RunJobFlow and ListClusters to get ClusterIDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsRequest.StepCancellationOption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StepCancellationOption.
The option to choose to cancel RUNNING steps. By default, the value is SEND_INTERRUPT.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsRequest.StepIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StepIds.
The list of StepIDs to cancel. Use ListSteps to get steps and their states for the specified cluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsResponse
member.summary: The output for the CancelSteps operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CancelStepsResponse.CancelStepsInfoList
member.summary:

A list of CancelStepsInfo, which shows the status of specified cancel requests for each StepID specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
member.summary: The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm, which determines when an automatic scaling activity is triggered. When the defined alarm conditions are satisfied, scaling activity begins.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.ComparisonOperator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComparisonOperator.
Determines how the metric specified by MetricName is compared to the value specified by Threshold.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Dimensions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Dimensions.
A CloudWatch metric dimension.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.EvaluationPeriods
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EvaluationPeriods.
The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.MetricName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetricName.
The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Namespace
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Namespace.
The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is AWS/ElasticMapReduce.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Period
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Period.
The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. EMR CloudWatch metrics are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if an EMR CloudWatch metric is specified, specify 300.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Statistic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Statistic.
The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The default is AVERAGE.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Threshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Threshold.
The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CloudWatchAlarmDefinition.Unit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unit.
The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being watched. The value specified for Unit must correspond to the units specified in the CloudWatch metric.

The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of INSTANCE_GROUP indicates a uniform instance group configuration. A value of INSTANCE_FLEET indicates an instance fleets configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.KerberosAttributes
member.summary:

Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security configuration. For more information see Use Kerberos Authentication in the Amazon EMR Management Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.MasterPublicDnsName
member.summary:

The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.NormalizedInstanceHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NormalizedInstanceHours.
An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.OutpostArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is launched.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.PlacementGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlacementGroups.
Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.ReleaseLabel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReleaseLabel.
The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release labels are in the form emr-x.x.x, where x.x.x is an Amazon EMR release version such as emr-5.14.0. For more information about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions and features, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/. The release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and later. Earlier versions use AmiVersion.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.RepoUpgradeOnBoot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepoUpgradeOnBoot.
Applies only when CustomAmiID is used. Specifies the type of updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.RequestedAmiVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedAmiVersion.
The AMI version requested for this cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.RunningAmiVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RunningAmiVersion.
The AMI version running on this cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.ScaleDownBehavior
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScaleDownBehavior.
The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized. TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for clusters created using that version. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION indicates that Amazon EMR adds nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary. With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION is available only in Amazon EMR version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR earlier than 5.1.0.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.SecurityConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityConfiguration.
The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web Services resources on your behalf.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status details about the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.StepConcurrencyLevel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StepConcurrencyLevel.
Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags associated with a cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.TerminationProtected
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TerminationProtected.
Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a cluster error.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Cluster.VisibleToAllUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VisibleToAllUsers.
Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When true, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can perform EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies allow. When false, only the IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.
The default value is true if a value is not provided when creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI create-cluster command, or the Amazon Web Services Management Console. IAM principals that are allowed to perform actions on the cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on a running cluster. For more information, see Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting in the Amazon EMRManagement Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits
member.summary: The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling activity of a cluster can not be above or below these limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits.MaximumCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumCapacityUnits.
The upper boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits.MaximumCoreCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumCoreCapacityUnits.
The upper boundary of EC2 units for core node type in a cluster. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets. The core units are not allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation between core and task nodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits.MaximumOnDemandCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumOnDemandCapacityUnits.
The upper boundary of On-Demand EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets. The On-Demand units are not allowed to scale beyond this boundary. The parameter is used to split capacity allocation between On-Demand and Spot Instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits.MinimumCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumCapacityUnits.
The lower boundary of EC2 units. It is measured through vCPU cores or instances for instance groups and measured through units for instance fleets. Managed scaling activities are not allowed beyond this boundary. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ComputeLimits.UnitType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnitType.
The unit type used for specifying a managed scaling policy.

summary.para: An optional configuration specification to be used when provisioning cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications and software bundled with Amazon EMR. A configuration consists of a classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A classification refers to an application-specific configuration file. Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. For more information, see Configuring Applications.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateStudio operation. Creates a new Amazon EMR Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.AuthMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthMode.
Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or Amazon Web Services SSO.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.DefaultS3Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultS3Location.
The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and notebook files.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A detailed description of the Amazon EMR Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.EngineSecurityGroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineSecurityGroupId.
The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Engine security group. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from the Workspace security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.IdpAuthUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdpAuthUrl.
The authentication endpoint of your identity provider (IdP). Specify this value when you use IAM authentication and want to let federated users log in to a Studio with the Studio URL and credentials from your IdP. Amazon EMR Studio redirects users to this endpoint to enter credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.IdpRelayStateParameterName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdpRelayStateParameterName.
The name that your identity provider (IdP) uses for its RelayState parameter. For example, RelayState or TargetSource. Specify this value when you use IAM authentication and want to let federated users log in to a Studio using the Studio URL. The RelayState parameter differs by IdP.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The IAM role that the Amazon EMR Studio assumes. The service role provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other Amazon Web Services services.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.SubnetIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetIds.
A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must belong to the VPC specified by VpcId. Studio users can create a Workspace in any of the specified subnets.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.UserRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserRole.
The IAM user role that users and groups assume when logged in to an Amazon EMR Studio. Only specify a UserRole when you use Amazon Web Services SSO authentication. The permissions attached to the UserRole can be scoped down for each user or group using session policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.VpcId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcId.
The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate with the Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioRequest.WorkspaceSecurityGroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceSecurityGroupId.
The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateStudio operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioResponse.StudioId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StudioId.
The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioResponse.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The unique Studio access URL.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateStudioSessionMapping operation. Maps a user or group to the Amazon EMR Studio specified by StudioId, and applies a session policy to refine Studio permissions for that user or group. Use CreateStudioSessionMapping to assign users to a Studio when you use Amazon Web Services SSO authentication. For instructions on how to assign users to a Studio when you use IAM authentication, see Assign a user or group to your EMR Studio.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest.IdentityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityId.
The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the user or group from the Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store. For more information, see UserId and GroupId in the Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store API Reference. Either IdentityName or IdentityId must be specified, but not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest.IdentityName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityName.
The name of the user or group. For more information, see UserName and DisplayName in the Amazon Web Services SSO Identity Store API Reference. Either IdentityName or IdentityId must be specified, but not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest.IdentityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityType.
Specifies whether the identity to map to the Amazon EMR Studio is a user or a group.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest.SessionPolicyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionPolicyArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the session policy that will be applied to the user or group. You should specify the ARN for the session policy that you want to apply, not the ARN of your user role. For more information, see Create an EMR Studio User Role with Session Policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingRequest.StudioId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StudioId.
The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio to which the user or group will be mapped.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.CreateStudioSessionMappingResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.DescribeJobFlowsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeJobFlows operation. This API is no longer supported and will eventually be removed. We recommend you use ListClusters, DescribeCluster, ListSteps, ListInstanceGroups and ListBootstrapActions instead.
DescribeJobFlows returns a list of job flows that match all of the supplied parameters. The parameters can include a list of job flow IDs, job flow states, and restrictions on job flow creation date and time.
Regardless of supplied parameters, only job flows created within the last two months are returned.
If no parameters are supplied, then job flows matching either of the following criteria are returned:
Job flows created and completed in the last two weeks
Job flows created within the last two months that are in one of the following states: RUNNING, WAITING, SHUTTING_DOWN, STARTING
Amazon EMR can return a maximum of 512 job flow descriptions.

member.summary:

Set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value, and your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Ec2InstanceAttributes.IamInstanceProfile
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamInstanceProfile.
The IAM role that was specified when the cluster was launched. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Ec2InstanceAttributes.RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones.
Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies one or more Availability Zones in which to launch EC2 cluster instances when the EC2-Classic network configuration is supported. Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit from among the list of RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones, and then launches all cluster instances within that Availability Zone. If you do not specify this value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone for you. RequestedEc2SubnetIDs and RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones cannot be specified together.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Ec2InstanceAttributes.RequestedEc2SubnetIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedEc2SubnetIds.
Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies the unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in which to launch EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the same VPC. Amazon EMR chooses the EC2 subnet with the best fit from among the list of RequestedEc2SubnetIds, and then launches all cluster instances within that Subnet. If this value is not specified, and the account and Region support EC2-Classic networks, the cluster launches instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones instead of this setting. If EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR chooses the subnet for you. RequestedEc2SubnetIDs and RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones cannot be specified together.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.Ec2InstanceAttributes.ServiceAccessSecurityGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceAccessSecurityGroup.
The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetBlockPublicAccessConfiguration operation. Returns the Amazon EMR block public access configuration for your Amazon Web Services account in the current Region. For more information see Configure Block Public Access for Amazon EMR in the Amazon EMR Management Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetBlockPublicAccessConfiguration operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.
A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration applies to all clusters created in your account for the current Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an exception using PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges in the BlockPublicAccessConfiguration. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can change this by updating the block public access configuration to remove the exception.
For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25, 2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.GetBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse.BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicAccessConfigurationMetadata.
Properties that describe the Amazon Web Services principal that created the BlockPublicAccessConfiguration using the PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration action as well as the date and time that the configuration was created. Each time a configuration for block public access is updated, Amazon EMR updates this metadata.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet
member.summary:
Describes an instance fleet, which is a group of EC2 instances that host a particular node type (master, core, or task) in an Amazon EMR cluster. Instance fleets can consist of a mix of instance types and On-Demand and Spot Instances, which are provisioned to meet a defined target capacity.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the instance fleet.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.InstanceFleetType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceFleetType.
The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, or TASK.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.InstanceTypeSpecifications
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceTypeSpecifications.
An array of specifications for the instance types that comprise an instance fleet.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.LaunchSpecifications
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LaunchSpecifications.
Describes the launch specification for an instance fleet.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A friendly name for the instance fleet.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity.
The number of On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet to fulfill TargetOnDemandCapacity. This provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than TargetOnDemandCapacity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.ProvisionedSpotCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProvisionedSpotCapacity.
The number of Spot units that have been provisioned for this instance fleet to fulfill TargetSpotCapacity. This provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than TargetSpotCapacity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the instance fleet.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.TargetOnDemandCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetOnDemandCapacity.
The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for the instance fleet using TargetSpotCapacity. At least one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity should be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity can be specified, and its value must be 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleet.TargetSpotCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetSpotCapacity.
The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When a Spot instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.
If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned for the instance fleet. At least one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity should be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity can be specified, and its value must be 1.

The configuration that defines an instance fleet.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
If not specified or set to 0, only Spot Instances are provisioned for the instance fleet using TargetSpotCapacity. At least one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity should be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity can be specified, and its value must be 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleetConfig.TargetSpotCapacity
member.summary:

When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as specified by InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When a Spot Instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units.
If not specified or set to 0, only On-Demand Instances are provisioned for the instance fleet. At least one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity should be greater than 0. For a master instance fleet, only one of TargetSpotCapacity and TargetOnDemandCapacity can be specified, and its value must be 1.

member.summary:
The launch specification for Spot Instances in the fleet, which determines the defined duration, provisioning timeout behavior, and allocation strategy.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand and Spot Instance allocation strategies are available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and later.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OnDemandSpecification.

The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and later.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleetStatus
member.summary:
The status of the instance fleet.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleetStatus.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
A code representing the instance fleet status.
PROVISIONINGThe instance fleet is provisioning EC2 resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.
BOOTSTRAPPINGEC2 instances and other resources have been provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are underway.
RUNNINGEC2 instances and other resources are running. They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.
RESIZINGA resize operation is underway. EC2 instances are either being added or removed.
SUSPENDEDA resize operation could not complete. Existing EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or removed.
TERMINATINGThe instance fleet is terminating EC2 instances.
TERMINATEDThe instance fleet is no longer active, and all EC2 instances have been terminated.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceFleetStatus.StateChangeReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StateChangeReason.
Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timeline.
Provides historical timestamps for the instance fleet, including the time of creation, the time it became ready to run jobs, and the time of termination.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceGroup.AutoScalingPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingPolicy.
An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig
member.summary:
An instance type configuration for each instance type in an instance fleet, which determines the EC2 instances Amazon EMR attempts to provision to fulfill On-Demand and Spot target capacities. When you use an allocation strategy, you can include a maximum of 30 instance type configurations for a fleet. For more information about how to use an allocation strategy, see Configure Instance Fleets. Without an allocation strategy, you may specify a maximum of five instance type configurations for a fleet.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.BidPrice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BidPrice.
The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by InstanceType. Expressed in USD. If neither BidPrice nor BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice is provided, BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice defaults to 100%.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice.
The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot Instance as defined by InstanceType. Expressed as a number (for example, 20 specifies 20%). If neither BidPrice nor BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice is provided, BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice defaults to 100%.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.Configurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configurations.
A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications and software that run on the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.CustomAmiId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomAmiId.
The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.EbsConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EbsConfiguration.
The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as defined by InstanceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.InstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceType.
An EC2 instance type, such as m3.xlarge.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeConfig.WeightedCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WeightedCapacity.
The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig. This value is 1 for a master instance fleet, and must be 1 or greater for core and task instance fleets. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification
member.summary:
The configuration specification for each instance type in an instance fleet.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.BidPrice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BidPrice.
The bid price for each EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by InstanceType. Expressed in USD.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice.
The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each EC2 Spot Instance as defined by InstanceType. Expressed as a number (for example, 20 specifies 20%).

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.Configurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configurations.
A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications and software bundled with Amazon EMR.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.CustomAmiId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomAmiId.
The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.EbsBlockDevices
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EbsBlockDevices.
The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as defined by InstanceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.EbsOptimized
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EbsOptimized.
Evaluates to TRUE when the specified InstanceType is EBS-optimized.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.InstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceType.
The EC2 instance type, for example m3.xlarge.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.InstanceTypeSpecification.WeightedCapacity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WeightedCapacity.
The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the default value is 1.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AmiVersion.
Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later, ReleaseLabel is used. To specify a custom AMI, use CustomAmiID.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.AutoScalingRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingRole.
An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole. The IAM role provides a way for the automatic scaling feature to get the required permissions it needs to launch and terminate EC2 instances in an instance group.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.BootstrapActions

A list of the bootstrap actions run by the job flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.JobFlowId

The job flow identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.JobFlowRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobFlowRole.
The IAM role that was specified when the job flow was launched. The EC2 instances of the job flow assume this role.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.LogEncryptionKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogEncryptionKmsKeyId.
The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.LogUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogUri.
The location in Amazon S3 where log files for the job are stored.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the job flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.ScaleDownBehavior
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScaleDownBehavior.
The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized. TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for clusters created using that version. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION indicates that Amazon EMR adds nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary. With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION available only in Amazon EMR version 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR earlier than 5.1.0.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.ServiceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRole.
The IAM role that is assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access Amazon Web Services resources on your behalf.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.Steps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Steps.
A list of steps run by the job flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.SupportedProducts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SupportedProducts.
A list of strings set by third-party software when the job flow is launched. If you are not using third-party software to manage the job flow, this value is empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowDetail.VisibleToAllUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VisibleToAllUsers.
Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When true, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can perform EMR cluster actions that their IAM policies allow. When false, only the IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform EMR actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.
The default value is true if a value is not provided when creating a cluster using the EMR API RunJobFlow command, the CLI create-cluster command, or the Amazon Web Services Management Console. IAM principals that are authorized to perform actions on the cluster can use the SetVisibleToAllUsers action to change the value on a running cluster. For more information, see Understanding the EMR Cluster VisibleToAllUsers Setting in the Amazon EMRManagement Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig
member.summary: A description of the Amazon EC2 instance on which the cluster (job flow) runs. A valid JobFlowInstancesConfig must contain either InstanceGroups or InstanceFleets. They cannot be used together. You may also have MasterInstanceType, SlaveInstanceType, and InstanceCount (all three must be present), but we don't recommend this configuration.

member.name: M:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor used to set properties independently even when a simple constructor is available

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups.
A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups.
A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task nodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.Ec2KeyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ec2KeyName.
The name of the EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master node using SSH as the user called "hadoop."

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.Ec2SubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ec2SubnetId.
Applies to clusters that use the uniform instance group configuration. To launch the cluster in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value and your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.Ec2SubnetIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ec2SubnetIds.
Applies to clusters that use the instance fleet configuration. When multiple EC2 subnet IDs are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the optimal subnet.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.
The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node. If you specify EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup, you must also specify EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.
The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task nodes. If you specify EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup, you must also specify EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.HadoopVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HadoopVersion.
Applies only to Amazon EMR release versions earlier than 4.0. The Hadoop version for the cluster. Valid inputs are "0.18" (no longer maintained), "0.20" (no longer maintained), "0.20.205" (no longer maintained), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the AmiVersion parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.InstanceCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceCount.
The number of EC2 instances in the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.InstanceFleets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceFleets.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.
Describes the EC2 instances and instance configurations for clusters that use the instance fleet configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.InstanceGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceGroups.
Configuration for the instance groups in a cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps.
Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing all steps. Defaults to true. For more information about configuring cluster termination, see Control Cluster Termination in the EMR Management Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.MasterInstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterInstanceType.
The EC2 instance type of the master node.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.Placement
member.summary:

The Availability Zone in which the cluster runs.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.ServiceAccessSecurityGroup
member.summary:

The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.SlaveInstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlaveInstanceType.
The EC2 instance type of the core and task nodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesConfig.TerminationProtected
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TerminationProtected.
Specifies whether to lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a job-flow error.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail
member.summary: Specify the type of Amazon EC2 instances that the cluster (job flow) runs on.

member.summary: Empty constructor used to set properties independently even when a simple constructor is available

The Amazon EC2 core and task node instance type.

The number of Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster. If the value is 1, the same instance serves as both the master and core and task node. If the value is greater than 1, one instance is the master node and all others are core and task nodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.InstanceCount

The number of Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster. If the value is 1, the same instance serves as both the master and core and task node. If the value is greater than 1, one instance is the master node and all others are core and task nodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.InstanceGroups

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.MasterInstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterInstanceId.
The Amazon EC2 instance identifier of the master node.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.MasterInstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterInstanceType.
The Amazon EC2 master node instance type.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.MasterPublicDnsName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterPublicDnsName.
The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.NormalizedInstanceHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NormalizedInstanceHours.
An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is increased one time for every hour that an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more heavily, so an Amazon EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being increased incrementally four times. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.Placement
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Placement.
The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.SlaveInstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlaveInstanceType.
The Amazon EC2 core and task node instance type.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.JobFlowInstancesDetail.TerminationProtected
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TerminationProtected.
Specifies whether the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster are protected from termination by API calls, user intervention, or in the event of a job-flow error.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListNotebookExecutions operation. Provides summaries of all notebook executions. You can filter the list based on multiple criteria such as status, time range, and editor id. Returns a maximum of 50 notebook executions and a marker to track the paging of a longer notebook execution list across multiple ListNotebookExecution calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest.EditorId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EditorId.
The unique ID of the editor associated with the notebook execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest.From
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property From.
The beginning of time range filter for listing notebook executions. The default is the timestamp of 30 days ago.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest.Marker
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marker.
The pagination token, returned by a previous ListNotebookExecutions call, that indicates the start of the list for this ListNotebookExecutions call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status filter for listing notebook executions.
START_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received the execution request but execution has not begun.
STARTING indicates that the execution is starting on the cluster.
RUNNING indicates that the execution is being processed by the cluster.
FINISHING indicates that execution processing is in the final stages.
FINISHED indicates that the execution has completed without error.
FAILING indicates that the execution is failing and will not finish successfully.
FAILED indicates that the execution failed.
STOP_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received a StopNotebookExecution request and the stop is pending.
STOPPING indicates that the cluster is in the process of stopping the execution as a result of a StopNotebookExecution request.
STOPPED indicates that the execution stopped because of a StopNotebookExecution request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsRequest.To
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property To.
The end of time range filter for listing notebook executions. The default is the current timestamp.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListNotebookExecutions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsResponse.Marker
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marker.
A pagination token that a subsequent ListNotebookExecutions can use to determine the next set of results to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ListNotebookExecutionsResponse.NotebookExecutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotebookExecutions.
A list of notebook executions.

member.summary:

Specifies the next page of results. If NextToken is not specified, which is usually the case for the first request of ListReleaseLabels, the first page of results are determined by other filtering parameters or by the latest version. The ListReleaseLabels request fails if the identity (Amazon Web Services account ID) and all filtering parameters are different from the original request, or if the NextToken is expired or tampered with.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListSteps operation. Provides a list of steps for the cluster in reverse order unless you specify stepIds with the request or filter by StepStates. You can specify a maximum of 10 stepIDs. The CLI automatically paginates results to return a list greater than 50 steps. To return more than 50 steps using the CLI, specify a Marker, which is a pagination token that indicates the next set of steps to retrieve.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

The filter to limit the step list based on the identifier of the steps. You can specify a maximum of ten Step IDs. The character constraint applies to the overall length of the array.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ManagedScalingPolicy
member.summary: Managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. The policy specifies the limits for resources that can be added or terminated from a cluster. The policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ManagedScalingPolicy.ComputeLimits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComputeLimits.
The EC2 unit limits for a managed scaling policy. The managed scaling activity of a cluster is not allowed to go above or below these limits. The limit only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.MetricDimension
member.summary: A CloudWatch dimension, which is specified using a Key (known as a Name in CloudWatch), Value pair. By default, Amazon EMR uses one dimension whose Key is JobFlowID and Value is a variable representing the cluster ID, which is ${emr.clusterId}. This enables the rule to bootstrap when the cluster ID becomes available.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.MetricDimension.Key
member.summary:

The dimension name.

member.summary:

The dimension value.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.ModifyClusterRequest.StepConcurrencyLevel
member.summary:

The number of steps that can be executed concurrently. You can specify a minimum of 1 step and a maximum of 256 steps. We recommend that you do not change this parameter while steps are running or the ActionOnFailure setting may not behave as expected. For more information see Step$ActionOnFailure.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.Arn
member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.ExecutionEngine
member.summary:

The execution engine, such as an EMR cluster, used to run the EMR notebook and perform the notebook execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.LastStateChangeReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastStateChangeReason.
The reason for the latest status change of the notebook execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotebookExecutionId.
The unique identifier of a notebook execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.NotebookExecutionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotebookExecutionName.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.NotebookInstanceSecurityGroupId
member.summary:

The unique identifier of the EC2 security group associated with the EMR Notebook instance. For more information see Specifying EC2 Security Groups for EMR Notebooks in the EMR Management Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.NotebookParams
member.summary:

Input parameters in JSON format passed to the EMR Notebook at runtime for execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.OutputNotebookURI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputNotebookURI.
The location of the notebook execution's output file in Amazon S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The timestamp when notebook execution started.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the notebook execution.
START_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received the execution request but execution has not begun.
STARTING indicates that the execution is starting on the cluster.
RUNNING indicates that the execution is being processed by the cluster.
FINISHING indicates that execution processing is in the final stages.
FINISHED indicates that the execution has completed without error.
FAILING indicates that the execution is failing and will not finish successfully.
FAILED indicates that the execution failed.
STOP_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received a StopNotebookExecution request and the stop is pending.
STOPPING indicates that the cluster is in the process of stopping the execution as a result of a StopNotebookExecution request.
STOPPED indicates that the execution stopped because of a StopNotebookExecution request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecution.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags associated with a notebook execution. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.

The timestamp when notebook execution started.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotebookExecutionName.
The name of the notebook execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecutionSummary.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The timestamp when notebook execution started.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.NotebookExecutionSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the notebook execution.
START_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received the execution request but execution has not begun.
STARTING indicates that the execution is starting on the cluster.
RUNNING indicates that the execution is being processed by the cluster.
FINISHING indicates that execution processing is in the final stages.
FINISHED indicates that the execution has completed without error.
FAILING indicates that the execution is failing and will not finish successfully.
FAILED indicates that the execution failed.
STOP_PENDING indicates that the cluster has received a StopNotebookExecution request and the stop is pending.
STOPPING indicates that the cluster is in the process of stopping the execution as a result of a StopNotebookExecution request.
STOPPED indicates that the execution stopped because of a StopNotebookExecution request.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions
member.summary: Describes the strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.CapacityReservationPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CapacityReservationPreference.
Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible preferences include:
open - The instance can run in any open Capacity Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform, Availability Zone).
none - The instance avoids running in a Capacity Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an On-Demand Instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn.
The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandCapacityReservationOptions.UsageStrategy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UsageStrategy.
Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.
If you specify use-capacity-reservations-first, the fleet uses unused Capacity Reservations to fulfill On-Demand capacity up to the target On-Demand capacity. If multiple instance pools have unused Capacity Reservations, the On-Demand allocation strategy (lowest-price) is applied. If the number of unused Capacity Reservations is less than the On-Demand target capacity, the remaining On-Demand target capacity is launched according to the On-Demand allocation strategy (lowest-price).
If you do not specify a value, the fleet fulfills the On-Demand capacity according to the chosen On-Demand allocation strategy.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandProvisioningSpecification
member.summary:
The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions. On-Demand Instances allocation strategy is available in Amazon EMR version 5.12.1 and later.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandProvisioningSpecification.AllocationStrategy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllocationStrategy.
Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets. Currently, the only option is lowest-price (the default), which launches the lowest price first.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.OnDemandProvisioningSpecification.CapacityReservationOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CapacityReservationOptions.
The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PlacementGroupConfig
member.summary:
Placement group configuration for an Amazon EMR cluster. The configuration specifies the placement strategy that can be applied to instance roles during cluster creation.
To use this configuration, consider attaching managed policy AmazonElasticMapReducePlacementGroupPolicy to the EMR role.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PlacementGroupConfig.InstanceRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceRole.
Role of the instance in the cluster.
Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported instance role is MASTER.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PlacementGroupConfig.PlacementStrategy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlacementStrategy.
EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.
Starting with Amazon EMR version 5.23.0, the only supported placement strategy is SPREAD for the MASTER instance role.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PlacementType

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone.
The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster. AvailabilityZone is used for uniform instance groups, while AvailabilityZones (plural) is used for instance fleets.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PlacementType.AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZones.
When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone. AvailabilityZones is used for instance fleets, while AvailabilityZone (singular) is used for uniform instance groups.
The instance fleet configuration is available only in Amazon EMR versions 4.8.0 and later, excluding 5.0.x versions.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutAutoScalingPolicy operation. Creates or updates an automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates EC2 instances in response to the value of a CloudWatch metric.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutAutoTerminationPolicy operation. Creates or updates an auto-termination policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. An auto-termination policy defines the amount of idle time in seconds after which a cluster automatically terminates. For alternative cluster termination options, see Control cluster termination.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutBlockPublicAccessConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration operation. Creates or updates an Amazon EMR block public access configuration for your Amazon Web Services account in the current Region. For more information see Configure Block Public Access for Amazon EMR in the Amazon EMR Management Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutBlockPublicAccessConfigurationRequest.BlockPublicAccessConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicAccessConfiguration.
A configuration for Amazon EMR block public access. The configuration applies to all clusters created in your account for the current Region. The configuration specifies whether block public access is enabled. If block public access is enabled, security groups associated with the cluster cannot have rules that allow inbound traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 on a port, unless the port is specified as an exception using PermittedPublicSecurityGroupRuleRanges in the BlockPublicAccessConfiguration. By default, Port 22 (SSH) is an exception, and public access is allowed on this port. You can change this by updating BlockPublicSecurityGroupRules to remove the exception.
For accounts that created clusters in a Region before November 25, 2019, block public access is disabled by default in that Region. To use this feature, you must manually enable and configure it. For accounts that did not create an EMR cluster in a Region before this date, block public access is enabled by default in that Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutBlockPublicAccessConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutBlockPublicAccessConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutManagedScalingPolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutManagedScalingPolicy operation. Creates or updates a managed scaling policy for an Amazon EMR cluster. The managed scaling policy defines the limits for resources, such as EC2 instances that can be added or terminated from a cluster. The policy only applies to the core and task nodes. The master node cannot be scaled after initial configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutManagedScalingPolicyRequest.ClusterId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterId.
Specifies the ID of an EMR cluster where the managed scaling policy is attached.

member.name: P:Amazon.ElasticMapReduce.Model.PutManagedScalingPolicyRequest.ManagedScalingPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedScalingPolicy.
Specifies the constraints for the managed scaling policy.
